newsitem.title: FRANCE: Paribas and units rise on takeover talk.
newsitem.headline: Paribas and units rise on takeover talk.

text.p: Shares in holding company Groupe Paribas and its subsidiaries Cie Bancaire and Cetelem rose sharply on Thursday, on the back of continued speculation of a financial restructuring, analysts said.
Paribas traded up 3.43 percent at 401.30 francs, Bancaire up 4.39 percent at 785 francs and Cetelem was 4.72 percent higher at 754 at 1336 GMT.

Sector specialists said the rumours surrounding Paribas were recurring. "As the three stocks are rising at the same time, some are saying there must be something. But that is speculation," said one analyst said.
Paribas officials were not available for comment.
Some analysts think Paribas could sell its 42 percent stake in Bancaire, which in turn owns consumer credit house Cetelem, in order to strengthen its investment banking activities.

Others say Paribas could buy up the whole of Bancaire and sell it off in bits, in particular Cetelem. "If it did that it would benefit from a tax-loss shelter. But the transaction would be expensive," one analyst said.
The name often cited in the market as a potential acquisition target is U.S. investment bank DLJ, a unit of Equitable, which is a subsidiary of Axa.
But Axa denied on February 21 any plans to sell DLJ.
"In any case, if Paribas wants to focus on investment banking, it will have to sell Bancaire assets to reduce debt and finance external growth," an analyst said.
